events.comment: ACTIVATES the event if it is EQUAL to 1

When the layout starts reset the global variables to their defaults, save off the positions of the draggable text objects in their own instance variables and position the game over layer objects for use when the game is over.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Matches: " & varHowManyMatches & newline & "varIsMatchingArea1: " & varIsMatchingArea1 & newline & "varIsMatchingArea2: " & varIsMatchingArea2 & newline & "varIsMatchingArea3: " & varIsMatchingArea3

action.name: Set text
action.param: "ID " & dragObject.ID & newline & "StartX, StartY: " & dragObject.startX & ", " & dragObject.startY & newline & "Drag and drop: " & dragObject.IsOneComingBack & newline & "how many on 1: " & varHowManyItemsOnArea1 & newline & "IID: " & dragObject.IID

action.name: Set text
action.param: "ID " & dragObject2.ID & newline & "StartX, StartY: " & dragObject2.startX & ", " & dragObject2.startY & newline & "Drag and drop: " & dragObject2.IsOneComingBack & newline & "how many on 2: " & varHowManyItemsOnArea2 & newline & "IID: " & dragObject2.IID

event-group.title: Group Put Back on Starting (Initial) Position

sub-events.comment: WRONG: If the item is released anywhere and it's not correct, set its position back to starting position.

If the draggable text object has not been matched and is not overlapping an image object, repositon the draggable text object back to its starting location. If you would rather, you can destroy the object instead by switching which actions are disabled.

event-group.title: Group Check Code and Add 1 to Tries

sub-events.comment: When a draggable object is dropped, it is considered a try, so increment Tries. Then check to see if the text was dropped on an image object.
Next, check if the draggable object was dropped on an image object, check to see if the image object's description instance variable matches the draggable text object's text.

CORRECT: If the description matches the text, position the draggable text object under the image object and disable drag for this object as well as set the draggable object's matched instance variable to true. Add to matches.
Next, check if the draggable object was dropped on an image object, check to see if the image object's description instance variable matches the draggable text object's text.

CORRECT: If the description matches the text, position the draggable text object under the image object and disable drag for this object as well as set the draggable object's matched instance variable to true. Add to matches.
Next, check if the draggable object was dropped on an image object, check to see if the image object's description instance variable matches the draggable text object's text.

CORRECT: If the description matches the text, position the draggable text object under the image object and disable drag for this object as well as set the draggable object's matched instance variable to true. Add to matches.
Add 1 to count (and we count 3 its WIN (game over))
